DOC.brief_summary: This research aim facilitate successful implementation new Heart Stroke Foundation Ontario dysphagia screen model acute stroke patient . The objective 1 ) determine natural history dysphagia screen skill decay , 2 ) ass benefit independent web-based practice periodic feedback screening skill maintenance . We enrol convenience sample nurse currently work stroke patient prior formal training dysphagia screening . The study consist 2 phase : A ) initial pilot phase follow B ) prospective randomize control study . During Phase A , three new web-based , self-instructed skill refresher course develop help nurse maintain skill learn 8-hour workshop dysphagia screen . During Phase B , nurse receive 8-hour workshop one-on-one evaluation speech-language pathologist ( SLP ) . Following training , competent screener randomize one two group : Group A - Control group refresher course periodic feedback SLP ; Group B - Web-based skill refresher course . Nurses evaluate several timepoints throughout Phase B assess theoretical dysphagia screen knowledge skill .
